s. s. van dine.gloss: United States writer of detective novels (1888-1939)

s. smith stevens.gloss: United States psychologist and psychophysicist who proposed Stevens' power law to replace Fechner's law (1906-1973)

ss.gloss: the United States intelligence agency that protects current and former presidents and vice presidents and their immediate families and protects distinguished foreign visitors
special police force in Nazi Germany founded as a personal bodyguard for Adolf Hitler in 1925

ssa.gloss: an independent government agency responsible for the Social Security system

sse.gloss: the compass point midway between south and southeast

sspe.gloss: a rare chronic progressive encephalitis caused by the measles virus and occurring primarily in children and young adults

ssri.gloss: an antidepressant drug that acts by blocking the reuptake of serotonin so that more serotonin is available to act on receptors in the brain

sss.gloss: an independent federal agency that administers compulsory military service

ssw.gloss: the compass point midway between south and southwest
